statements: SELECT * FROM GeneticVariants;
SELECT variant_name, gene_name, phenotype FROM GeneticVariants;
SELECT variant_id, gene_name, chromosome_number FROM GeneticVariants WHERE chromosome_number = 19;
SELECT variant_name, position FROM GeneticVariants WHERE gene_name = 'BRCA1';
SELECT * FROM GeneticVariants ORDER BY chromosome_number ASC, position DESC;
SELECT * FROM GeneticVariants WHERE chromosome_number = 5 ORDER BY position DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT variant_name, gene_name FROM GeneticVariants WHERE gene_name = 'BRCA1'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM GeneticVariants WHERE phenotype LIKE 'Cancer%'
SELECT * FROM GeneticVariants WHERE chromosome_number IN (1, 2, 3) ORDER BY gene_name, position DESC
SELECT DISTINCT gene_name, COUNT(*) as variant_count FROM GeneticVariants GROUP BY gene_name HAVING variant_count > 5
SELECT * FROM variants;
SELECT variant_name, gene_name FROM variants WHERE chromosome = 'X';
SELECT * FROM variants ORDER BY position DESC;
SELECT variant_name, gene_name FROM variants WHERE gene_name LIKE 'BRCA%';
SELECT id, variant_name, chromosome FROM variants WHERE position > 1000 AND chromosome = 'Y';
SELECT * FROM variants ORDER BY gene_name DESC, position ASC;
SELECT variant_name, chromosome, position FROM variants WHERE chromosome = 'Chr1';
SELECT phenotype_name, description FROM phenotypes WHERE id = 1;
SELECT variant_id, COUNT(*) FROM phenotypes GROUP BY variant_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;
SELECT gene_name, chromosome, position FROM variants WHERE gene_name LIKE 'A%' AND chromosome = 'Chr2';
SELECT * FROM variants;
SELECT variant_name, chromosome, position FROM variants WHERE chromosome = 'X';
SELECT variant_name, reference, alternate FROM variants WHERE position > 10000;
SELECT variant_id, variant_name, chromosome, position FROM variants WHERE position BETWEEN 5000 AND 10000;
SELECT variant_name, chromosome, position, reference, alternate FROM variants WHERE chromosome = 'Y' AND position < 5000;
SELECT * FROM variants WHERE chromosome = 'X';
SELECT variant_name, position FROM variants WHERE reference = 'A' AND alternate = 'T';
SELECT v.variant_name, p.phenotype_name FROM variants v JOIN variant_phenotype vp ON v.variant_id = vp.variant_id JOIN phenotypes p ON vp.phenotype_id = p.phenotype_id WHERE v.position < 1000;
SELECT * FROM phenotypes WHERE description IS NOT NULL ORDER BY phenotype_id DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_variants FROM variants;
SELECT * FROM variants;
SELECT id, name, location FROM variants ORDER BY location DESC;
SELECT name, allele FROM variants WHERE id = 1;
SELECT id, name FROM phenotypes WHERE id > 5;
SELECT * FROM research_studies WHERE start_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2022-01-01';
SELECT * FROM variants WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, location FROM variants WHERE allele = 'A';
SELECT v.name, p.description FROM variants v JOIN variant_phenotype vp ON v.id = vp.variant_id JOIN phenotypes p ON vp.phenotype_id = p.id;
SELECT study_name, start_date, end_date FROM research_studies WHERE start_date > '2020-01-01' ORDER BY end_date DESC;

SELECT v.name AS variant_name, p.name AS phenotype_name FROM variants v JOIN variant_phenotype vp ON v.id = vp.variant_id JOIN phenotypes p ON vp.phenotype_id = p.id WHERE vp.phenotype_id IN (SELECT id FROM phenotypes WHERE name LIKE 'Cancer%');
SELECT * FROM Variant;
SELECT variant_name, chromosome, gene FROM Variant WHERE position > 1000;
SELECT variant_id, variant_name, chromosome, position, gene FROM Variant WHERE gene = 'BRCA1';
SELECT * FROM Phenotype WHERE phenotype_name = 'Cancer';
SELECT variant_name, chromosome, position FROM Variant WHERE gene = 'TP53';
SELECT variant_name, position FROM Variant WHERE chromosome = 'X' ORDER BY position DESC;
SELECT * FROM Variant WHERE gene = 'BRCA1';

SELECT Variant.variant_name, Phenotype.phenotype_name FROM VariantPhenotype INNER JOIN Variant ON Variant.variant_id = VariantPhenotype.variant_id INNER JOIN Phenotype ON Phenotype.phenotype_id = VariantPhenotype.phenotype_id;
SELECT Researcher.full_name, Publication.title FROM Researcher INNER JOIN Publication ON Researcher.researcher_id = Publication.researcher_id WHERE Researcher.affiliation = 'Harvard University';
SELECT DISTINCT gene, COUNT(variant_id) FROM Variant GROUP BY gene ORDER BY COUNT(variant_id) DESC;
